question.questionText: How can you use a magnet to find out if the key is iron or aluminum?

referenceAnswers.referenceAnswer: If the key sticks, the key is iron; if the key does not stick the key is aluminum.

studentAnswers.studentAnswer: If it is iron it will stick if it is aluminum it will not stick.
It will be made of iron if it sticks to a magnet.
The magnet will stick to iron not to aluminum.
If it is iron it will stick.
I will stick or not stick.
It will stick to iron.
By testing it with a magnet and it will stick if it is iron.
If the key sticks it is made of iron if it does not it is made of aluminum.
If it is iron the key will stick if it is aluminum it would not stick.
Aluminum will stick to a magnet.
If it were iron it would stick.
You could get something with magnitite in it and see if it sticks if it sticks you know it is iron if it does not stick it is aluminum.

The magnet will stick.
The key will stick if it is iron but if it is aluminum it will not.

The magnet will stick.
